      • build

        public ClassFilter build()

      • setPackages

        public ClassFilter.Builder setPackages​(@Nonnull
                                       java.lang.String... packages)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes from the specified packages only.

        Note: This will silently overwrite skipPackages().

        Parameters:
        packages - package names
        Returns:
        this builder

      • skipPackages

        public ClassFilter.Builder skipPackages​(@Nullable
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> packages,
                                        @Nullable
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> exception)
        Specify a list of packages that should be excluded.

        Note: This will silently overwrite setPackages().

        Parameters:
        packages - a list of packages to exclude
        exception - an exception list to allow sub packages (can be null)
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setClasses

        public ClassFilter.Builder setClasses​(@Nonnull
                                      java.lang.String... classes)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes that match with any of the specified classes.

        Note: This method takes the full names of classes (eg: java.io.FileReader). If you want to search with simple class names (eg: FileReader), use setClassSimpleNames() instead.

        Parameters:
        classes - full names of classes
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        setClassSimpleNames(names)

      • setClassSimpleNames

        public ClassFilter.Builder setClassSimpleNames​(@Nonnull
                                               java.lang.String... names)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes that match with any of the specified class names.

        Note: This method takes the Simple Names of classes. This is different from setClasses(), which takes the full names instead.

        Parameters:
        names - simple names of classes
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        setClasses(classes)

      • setModifiers

        public ClassFilter.Builder setModifiers​(int modifiers)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes with the specified class modifiers.
        Examples:
        setModifiers(Modifier.PUBLIC)
        Use | operator to set multiple modifiers:
        setModifiers(Modifier.PUBLIC | Modifier.FINAL)
        Parameters:
        modifiers - class modifiers, or -1 to reset
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        skipModifiers(int)

      • skipModifiers

        public ClassFilter.Builder skipModifiers​(int modifiers)
        Classes with the specified class modifiers will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        modifiers - class modifiers, or -1 to reset
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        setModifiers(int)

      • setSuperClass

        public ClassFilter.Builder setSuperClass​(@Nullable
                                         java.lang.String superclass)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes with the specified superclass.
        Parameters:
        superclass - full name of a superclass
        Returns:
        this builder

      • defaultSuperClass

        public ClassFilter.Builder defaultSuperClass()
        This is equivalent to calling:
        setSuperClass(Object.class.getName())
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        setSuperClass(String)

      • setInterfaces

        public ClassFilter.Builder setInterfaces​(@Nullable
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> iFaces)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes with the specified interfaces.

        Note: Interface list must match exactly.

        Parameters:
        iFaces - full names of interfaces
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        noInterfaces()

      • noInterfaces

        public ClassFilter.Builder noInterfaces()
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes that do not have any interfaces.
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        setInterfaces(List)

      • setSourceNames

        public ClassFilter.Builder setSourceNames​(@Nonnull
                                          java.lang.String... sources)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes from the specified source files.

        Examples: "Application.java", "AnyFileName.java" etc.

        Parameters:
        sources - source file names
        Returns:
        this builder

      • containsAnnotations

        public ClassFilter.Builder containsAnnotations​(@Nonnull
                                               java.lang.String... annotations)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes that contain all the specified annotations.
        Parameters:
        annotations - full names of annotation classes
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        containsAnnotationValues(String...)

      • containsAnnotationValues

        public ClassFilter.Builder containsAnnotationValues​(@Nonnull
                                                    java.lang.String... annotationValues)
        Add a condition to the filter to match classes that contain all the specified annotation values.

        Currently supports only string and type values.

           STRING Values: @SomeAnnot("string") @AnotherAnnot({"string1", "string2"})
   Example: filter.containsAnnotationValues("string", "string1")

   TYPE Values: @Annot(Runnable.class), @Annot(Thread.class)
   Example: filter.containsAnnotationValues("java.lang.Runnable", "java.lang.Thread")
        Parameters:
        annotationValues - annotation values
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        containsAnnotations(String...)

      • setNumbers

        public ClassFilter.Builder setNumbers​(@Nonnull
                                      java.lang.Number... numbers)
        Add a condition to the filter to match methods that contain all the specified numbers.

        Note: Each float value must end with an 'f' character.

        Parameters:
        numbers - list of numbers to match
        Returns:
        this builder
